note.p: Death: His house in Leicester Fields, London (23 February 1792)
Burial: Next to the grave of Bishop Newton and near that of Wren, in the crypt of St Paul's Cathedral, London
Memberships: Royal Academy (first President 1768-1792); Royal Society of Arts;
References: Martin Kemp, 'True to Their Natures: Sir Joshua Reynolds and Dr William Hunter at the Royal Academy of Arts' in NR 1992 vol 46 pp 77-88
John R Levene, 'Benjamin Franklin, FRS, Sir Joshua Reynolds, FRS, PRA, Benjamin West, PRA and the Invention of Bifocals' in NR 1972-3 vol 27 pp 141-163, plate
W P Griffith and P J T Morris, 'Charles Hatchett FRS (1765 - 1847), chemist and discoverer of niobium' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 299 - 316
